B62E1M231
2017-08-22 14:32:16

[cucumber/cucumber-js] charlierudolph commented on #906: Allow absolute formatter output paths. Fixes #900.

<p>Why are there three curly braces? In the mustache documentation it appears you only need two.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/906#discussion_r134606378">Comment by charlierudolph on line 29 of features/formatter_paths.feature</a>
<p>I don't like this step. It appears to only be testing that we are using mustache templates correctly. If we remove this step, does the test still fail if we revert the source code change?</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/906#discussion_r134606939">Comment by charlierudolph on line 30 of features/formatter_paths.feature</a>
B62E1M231
2017-08-22 15:48:17

[cucumber/cucumber-js] darrinholst commented on #906: Allow absolute formatter output paths. Fixes #900.

<p>mustache html escapes by default which was escaping the <code>/</code>. Triple <code>{</code> returns the raw value.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/906#discussion_r134620231">Comment by darrinholst on line 29 of features/formatter_paths.feature</a>
B62E1M231
2017-08-22 15:56:15

[cucumber/cucumber-js] darrinholst commented on #906: Allow absolute formatter output paths. Fixes #900.

<p>My thinking there was that I don't have any control over what <code>tmpDir</code> is. It could be relative to the working directory for all I know so it was just some extra assurance that we are really fixing the problem.</p> <p>Yes, the test will still fail if it's removed...as long as <code>tmpDir</code> is and always continues to be an absolute path.</p> <p>I can remove it if you want.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/906#discussion_r134621391">Comment by darrinholst on line 30 of features/formatter_paths.feature</a>
B62E1M231
2017-08-22 18:40:17

[cucumber/cucumber-js] charlierudolph commented on #906: Allow absolute formatter output paths. Fixes #900.

<p>Cool. Thanks for the explanation</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/906#discussion_r134640267">Comment by charlierudolph on line 29 of features/formatter_paths.feature</a>
B62E1M231
2017-08-22 18:43:17

[cucumber/cucumber-js] charlierudolph commented on #906: Allow absolute formatter output paths. Fixes #900.

<p>Okay. That sounds like an important precondition. Thoughts on using a 'Given' step instead? Maybe one that says: 'Given "{{{tmpDir}}}" is an absolute path'</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] charlierudolph commented on #911: Change duration to be in ticks

<p>Thinking about this more what do you think of the following: use milliseconds internally and in the json and event protocol formatter convert it to nanoseconds? I think that will be easier to deal with since javascript uses milliseconds as the standard</p>
<p>Thoughts on replacing <code>1000000</code> with <code>Math.pow(10, 6)</code></p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/911#discussion_r135059887">Comment by charlierudolph on line 8 of src/formatter/helpers/summary_helpers.js</a>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] charlierudolph commented on #907: Allow cucumber to be used as an unreleased (git) dependency

<p>This script does more than what the comment says. I think it should be something like, "If installed as an unreleased git dependency, installs the dev dependencies and compiles the source"</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/907#discussion_r136092746">Comment by charlierudolph on line 5 of scripts/build-local.js</a>
<p>Thoughts on calling the script something like <code>node scripts/build-non-release.js</code>?</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/907#discussion_r136092545">Comment by charlierudolph on line 6 of package.json</a>
<p>prepublish and prefeature-test should remain as they were. The lib folder needs to be updated even it if exists in order to ensure it contains the latest code</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/907#discussion_r136091677">Comment by charlierudolph on line 8 of package.json</a>
<p>I think this check can be removed and we instead always run <code>npm install</code></p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/907#discussion_r136093156">Comment by charlierudolph on line 11 of scripts/build-local.js</a>
B62E1M231
2017-08-30 13:56:17

[cucumber/cucumber-js] aslakhellesoy commented on #907: Allow cucumber to be used as an unreleased (git) dependency

<p>No, it needs to be there, or we'll end up with infinite recursion.</p> <p>After the script runs <code>npm install</code>, the <code>postinstall</code> script runs again, and this time we <em>don't</em> want to run <code>npm install</code>.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/907#discussion_r136186901">Comment by aslakhellesoy on line 11 of scripts/build-local.js</a>
B62E1M231
2017-09-01 11:06:16

[cucumber/cucumber-js] kriswill commented on #907: Allow cucumber to be used as an unreleased (git) dependency

<p>NPM will always be present with node.js, yarn isn't guaranteed to be present. Perhaps, test if yarn is installed before using it?</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/907#discussion_r136633973">Comment by kriswill on line 9 of scripts/build-non-release.js</a>
B62E1M231
2017-09-01 11:13:15

[cucumber/cucumber-js] kriswill commented on #907: Allow cucumber to be used as an unreleased (git) dependency

<p>Here's the timings with latest NPM: ```kris git[master?] ~/src/oss/cucumber-js<br /> → npm --versions { cucumber: '3.0.1', npm: '5.3.0', ares: '1.10.1-DEV', cldr: '31.0.1', http_parser: '2.7.0', icu: '59.1', modules: '57', nghttp2: '1.22.0', node: '8.4.0', openssl: '1.0.2l', tz: '2017b', unicode: '9.0', uv: '1.13.1', v8: '6.0.286.52', zlib: '1.2.11' }</p> <pre><code>and installation: ```kris git[master] ~/src/oss/cucumber-js → npm i ... npm notice created a lockfile as package-lock.json. You should commit this file. added 912 packages in 24.784s </code></pre>

B62E1M231

<p>without yarn installed globally:</p> <pre><code>&amp;gt; cucumber-expressions@4.0.3 postinstall /Users/kris/src/oss/cucumber-js/node_modules/cucumber-expressions &amp;gt; node scripts/postinstall.js npm WARN prepublish-on-install As of npm@5, `prepublish` scripts are deprecated. npm WARN prepublish-on-install Use `prepare` for build steps and `prepublishOnly` for upload-only. npm WARN prepublish-on-install See the deprecation note in `npm help scripts` for more information. &amp;gt; cucumber@3.0.1 prepublish /Users/kris/src/oss/cucumber-js &amp;gt; yarn run build-local sh: yarn: command not found npm ERR! file sh npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE npm ERR! errno ENOENT npm ERR! syscall spawn npm ERR! cucumber@3.0.1 prepublish: `yarn run build-local` npm ERR! spawn ENOENT npm ERR! npm ERR! Failed at the cucumber@3.0.1 prepublish script. </code></pre>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] kriswill commented on #907: Allow cucumber to be used as an unreleased (git) dependency

<p><a href="https://github.com/charlike/detect-installed">https://github.com/charlike/detect-installed</a> seems like a reasonable module to use to detect the presence of yarn:</p> <p><code>const detectInstalled = require('detect-installed') const exists = await detectInstalled('yarn') </code></p>

2017-10-02 10:50:22

[cucumber/cucumber-js] charlierudolph commented on #940: Support repeatable tags option

<p>I think this test would pass without your source code change (which is why its important to write your tests first) because <code>second scenario - Z</code> is the only scenario with <code>@d</code>. Thus without the repeatable option, I expect this to pass. Maybe switch to <code>@a</code> and <code>@d</code>?</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/940#discussion_r142208273">Comment by charlierudolph on line 5 of features/target_specific_scenarios_by_tag.feature</a>
B62E1M231
2017-10-04 01:51:18

[cucumber/cucumber-js] kmate commented on #930: Custom separator support for rerun formatter

<p>Nice catch. Actually I needed to define both the option and the expected separator.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/930#discussion_r142613815">Comment by kmate on line 55 of src/formatter/rerun_formatter_spec.js</a>
B62E1M231
2017-10-04 07:50:22

[cucumber/cucumber-js] charlierudolph commented on #942: Refactor exit flow to limit forceful termination

<p>The issue had discussed using a CLI option and I would still prefer that. We could use it in this file with something like ‘cli.shouldDrainEventLoop()’ to use process.exitCode and otherwise use the existing logic</p>

Hello, for the documentation, could someone please tell me what (if anything) the javascript equivalent is of the Cucumber::Ambiguous error / AmbiguousStepDefinitionsException? (i.e. what is thrown when defining Ambiguous Steps?). Thanks! (Reason: https://github.com/cucumber/docs.cucumber.io/pull/50)

GitHub
Merge step-definition files and merge anti-patterns by mlvandijk · Pull Request #50 · cucumber/docs.cucumber.io
As suggested in the todos (see #25), I've merged 2 files about step-definitions and also merged 2 files about anti-patterns. In addition, I've (tried to) generalize these documents and add text/exa...
charlierudolph
2017-10-22 12:45:09

JS has "ambiguous" as a step / scenario status (along with "passed", "failed", "pending", "undefined", "skipped"). It does not throw an error anywhere

mlvandijk
2017-10-22 20:19:08

Good to know; I'll update the PR. Thanks @charlierudolph

charlierudolph
2017-12-01 10:16:10

@Aslak Hellesøy how did you merge https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/980? I have the setting on the repo to only allow squash merging to make it so 1) looking at the commits on master its easy to see the progression of features since you won't see WIP commits and 2) its easy to rollback everything from a single PR by reverting a single commit.

GitHub
Upgrade to cucumber-expressions@5.0.6 and tag-expressions@1.1.0 by aslakhellesoy · Pull Request #980 · cucumber/cucumber-js
cucumber-expressions@5.0.6 backports RegExp#flags, which should make the build pass on Node 4.

Bas
2018-05-18 03:59:13

I was wondering about the design choice of using "--format-options <JSON>" instead of traditional -- option parsing. I'm integrating cucumber into the pipeline and Jenkins is throwing a lot of errors because of the quotes within the JSON string, whereas it is able to parse regular --option flags. I'd prefer the old "--no-color" instead of "--format-options '{"colorsEnabled": false}' "

Bas
2018-05-18 03:59:24

Or even "--color=false" for all that matters

mpkorstanje
2018-05-18 04:11:17

I was hoping @charlierudolph would be in here.

iiicubed
2018-05-18 08:21:51

@iiicubed has joined the channel

charlierudolph
2018-05-26 10:26:03

Sorry been busy with a new job. Design choice for the format options was around wanting to group the format options and move them out of top level. We can probably switch to something like --format-option=colors=false

Aslak Hellesøy
2019-10-14 14:43:18

I’m a bit concerned about the changes to the JSON format in Cucumber.js 6.0.0 as it seems to have broken tools that consume the JSON format. @charlierudolph what was the motivation for changing this and how hard would it be to revert the change and make a new release?

Aslak Hellesøy
2019-10-14 14:46:43

Looking at the changelog I’m unable to find what issue/PR/commit the JSON fornatter was changed in. We should start adding links to issues/PRs for all changes in the changelog. Like this: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/blob/master/cucumber-expressions/CHANGELOG.md

cucumber-expressions/CHANGELOG.md
<p>```</p> <h1>CHANGE LOG</h1> <p>All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.</p> <p>The format is based on <a href="http://keepachangelog.com/">Keep a Changelog</a> and this project adheres to <a href="http://semver.org/">Semantic Versioning</a>.</p> <hr /> <h2>[Unreleased]</h2> <h3>Added</h3> <h3>Changed</h3> <h3>Deprecated</h3> <h3>Removed</h3> <h3>Fixed</h3> <h2>[8.0.1] - 2019-10-07</h2> <h3>Fixed</h3> <p>** [JavaScript] Support Node 8 (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/732">#732</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/725">#725</a> [charlierudolph])</p> <h2>[8.0.0] - 2019-08-11</h2> <h3>Added</h3> <p><em>* [Java] Annotate function interfaces with @FunctionalInterface (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/1716">cucumber/cucumber-jvm#1716</a> [mpkorstanje]) *</em> [Java] Mark public api with @API Guardian annotations (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/1536">cucumber/cucumber-jvm#1536</a> [mpkorstanje])</p> <h3>Changed</h3> <p><em>* Improve decimal number parsing (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/669">#669</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/672">#672</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/675">#675</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/677">#677</a> [mpkorstanje]) *</em> Only suggest parameter types when text is surrounded by whitespace or punctuation (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/657">#657</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/661">#661</a> [vincent-psarga] [aslakhellesoy] [luke-hill] [mpkorstanje]) <em>* Upgrades to <code>cucumber-parent:2.0.2</code> *</em> [Java] Simplify heuristics to distinguish between Cucumber Expressions and Regular Expressions (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/515">#515</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/581">#581</a> [mpkorstanje]) ** [Java/Go] cucumber-expressions: Prefer language type hint over parameter type (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/658">#658</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/659">#659</a> [mpkorstanje])</p> <h3>Fixed</h3> <p>** Fix RegExp lookaround (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/643">#643</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/644">#644</a> [vincent-psarga] [mpkorstanje])</p> <p>** Match integer strings as <code>{float}</code>. (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/600">#600</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/605">#605</a> [aslakhellesoy] [vincent-psarga])</p> <p>** reconized lookaround as a non-capturing regex (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/576">#481</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/593">#593</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/643">#643</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/644">#644</a> [luke-hill])</p> <h2>[7.0.2] - 2019-06-15</h2> <h3>Fixed</h3> <p>** Support Boolean in BuiltInParameterTransformer (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/604">#604</a> [tommywo])</p> <h2>[7.0.0] - 2019-03-22</h2> <h3>Fixed</h3> <p><em>* Javascript release process *</em> Version numbering 🙈</p> <h2>[6.6.2] - 2019-03-22</h2> <p>This was a mistaken release due to [tooky]'s fat fingers.</p> <h2>[6.2.3] - 2019-03-22</h2> <h3>Fixed</h3> <p>** Ruby release process working again</p> <h2>[6.2.2] - 2019-03-16</h2> <h3>Changed</h3> <p>** Limit generated expressions to 256 (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/576">#576</a>, <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/574">#574</a> [mpkorstanje])</p> <h3>Fixed</h3> <p>** Allow parameter-types in escaped optional groups (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/572">#572</a>, <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/561">#561</a> [luke-hill], [jaysonesmith], [mpkorstanje])</p> <p>** Prefer expression with the longest non-empty match #580 (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/580">#580</a>, <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/575">#575</a> [mpkorstanje])</p> <h2>[6.2.1] - 2018-11-30</h2> <h3>Fixed</h3> <p>** (Java) Improve heuristics for creating Cucumber/Regular Expressions from strings (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/515">#515</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/518">#518</a> [aslakhellesoy])</p> <h2>[6.2.0] - 2018-10-28</h2> <h3>Added</h3> <p>** Add anonymous parameter types (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/496">#496</a> [mpkorstanje])</p> <h2>[6.1.2] - 2018-10-11</h2> <p>Same as 6.1.1 - just fixed a mistake made during the 6.1.1 release.</p> <h2>[6.1.1] - 2018-10-11</h2> <h3>Fixed</h3> <p>** (Java) Add the ability to supply an alternative algorithm for compiling <code>java.util.regex.Pattern</code> to work around a limitation on Android (and other platforms). (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/494">#494</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/498">#498</a> [lsuski]) </p> <h2>[6.1.0] - 2018-09-23</h2> <h3>Added</h3> <p>** (Java) Added <code>ParameterType.fromEnum(MyEnumClass.class)</code> to make it easier to register enums. (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/423">#423</a> [aslakhellesoy])</p> <h3>Removed</h3> <p>** java: OSGi support has been removed. (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/412">#412</a> [aslakhellesoy])</p> <h3>Fixed</h3> <p><em>* java: The text between <code>()</code> (optional text) can be unicode. (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/473">#473</a> [savkk] [aslakhellesoy] *</em> The built-in <code>{word}</code> parameter type handles unicode (any non-space character) (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/471">#471</a> [savkk] [aslakhellesoy] ** Parenthesis inside character class should not be treated as capture group. (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/454">#454</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/461">#461</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/463">#463</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/464">#464</a> [aidamanna] [aslakhellesoy] [spicalous])</p> <h2>[6.0.1] - 2018-06-14</h2> <h3>Added</h3> <p>** Allow <code>ParameterType</code> with no name (<code>nil</code>, <code>null</code>, <code>""</code>). Useful when the Parameter Type is only used in conjunction with Regular Expressions. (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/387">#387</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/410">#410</a> [aslakhellesoy])</p> <h3>Fixed</h3> <p><em>* Support empty capture groups. (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/404">#404</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/411">#411</a> [aslakhellesoy]) *</em> Better error message if a parameter type has a name with one of the characters <code>()[]$.|?**+</code>. (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/387">#387</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/410">#410</a> [aslakhellesoy])</p> <h2>[6.0.0] - 2018-05-30</h2> <h3>Changed</h3> <p>** Throw an error if a parameter type is used inside optional text parenthesis, or with alternative text. (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/360">#360</a> [aslakhellesoy])</p> <h3>Fixed</h3> <p>** Bugfix for nested capture groups. (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/375">#375</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/380">#380</a> [aslakhellesoy] [charlierudolph])</p> <h2>[5.0.19] - 2018-05-24</h2> <h3>Fixed</h3> <p>** java: Escape closing braces to avoid PatternSyntaxException on Android</p> <h2>[5.0.18] - 2018-05-21</h2> <h3>Changed</h3> <p>** java: The <code>{byte}</code> parameter type no longer uses hexadecimal, but uses the same pattern as <code>{short}</code>, <code>{int}</code> and <code>{long}</code>.</p> <h3>Fixed</h3> <p>** The <code>/</code> character can be escaped with <code>\/</code> in order to keep a literal <code>/</code> rather than interpreting it as alternation character. Generated expressions will use <code>\/</code> if the original text contains <code>/</code>. (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/391">#391</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/392">#392</a> [aslakhellesoy])</p> <h2>[5.0.17] - 2018-04-12</h2> <h3>Changed</h3> <p>** java: Swapped 2 parameters in a <code>ParameterType</code> constructor to make it consistent with overloaded constructors.</p> <h2>[5.0.16] - 2018-04-12</h2> <p>There are backwards incompatible changes in the Java implementation, but we're not bumping the minor version number because no released libraries are using it yet.</p> <h3>Changed</h3> <p><em>* java: Renamed <code>{bigint}</code> to <code>{biginteger}</code> ([mpkorstanje, aslakhellesoy]) *</em> java: The API uses <code>Transformer</code> for transforms with 0-1 capture groups, and <code>CaptureGroupTransformer</code> for 2+ capture groups.</p> <h3>Fi…</h3>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>

Aslak Hellesøy
2020-01-15 10:49:36

@David Goss something got messed up here: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/841

davidjgoss (https://github.com/davidjgoss)
#841 cucumber-expressions: remove node 8 support
<p><strong>Summary</strong></p> <p>Remove code and CI config that supports Node 8.</p> <p><strong>Details</strong></p> <p>• Remove Circle CI config that builds the expressions javascript library against Node 8 • Remove the regexp compatibility library that was only required to support Node 8</p> <p><strong>Motivation and Context</strong></p> <p>Fixes <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/738">#738</a>.</p> <p>Node 8 LTS <a href="https://nodejs.org/en/about/releases/">ends tomorrow</a>, which means cucumber no longer needs to support it.</p> <p><strong>How Has This Been Tested?</strong></p> <p>Covered by existing unit tests, which still pass.</p> <p><strong>Screenshots (if appropriate):</strong> <strong>Types of changes</strong></p> <p>☐ Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue). ☐ New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality). ☑︎ Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected) - as we are removing support for a platform version</p> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <p>☐ The change has been ported to Java. ☐ The change has been ported to Ruby. ☐ The change has been ported to JavaScript. ☐ The change has been ported to Go. ☐ The change has been ported to .NET. ☐ I've added tests for my code. ☐ My change requires a change to the documentation. ☐ I have updated the documentation accordingly.</p>

2020-01-15 10:58:24

David Goss
2020-01-15 11:04:51

Okay. Looks like still rewrites history so I may not be able to push the change without an admin switch being changed

David Goss
2020-01-15 11:35:20

Done a straight revert of the pull request via GitHub as a first step

David Goss
2020-01-15 11:39:34

Replayed this locally to work out what went wrong. I merged from master to fix a conflict, and this included the directory renames for messages, tag-expressions etc, which left all the node_modules from the old paths as unstaged new files, which I must have then scooped up with a misjudged git add and not noticed.

David Goss
2020-01-15 13:08:24

@Aslak Hellesøy I'm starting to experiment with BFG and filter-branch now. It's quite intrusive, going all the way through history looking for commits to rewrite. An alternative might be to just remove my commits from today and go back in time with git reset c692a37ae &amp;&amp; git push -f which would be relatively safe right now as the commits have not made it to any branches or tags yet. I did a dry run on a fork https://github.com/davidjgoss/cucumber and it did reduce the size of the repo back down.

Adam-ARK (https://github.com/Adam-ARK)
#1416 hooks: Add BeforeStep and AfterStep Hooks
<p>Another PR attempt to get BeforeStep/AfterStep hooks (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1058">#1058</a>) promoted into the project (hopefully for the 7.0.0 release), since the current open PR(<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/997">#997</a>) hasn't been touched since May. This PR used PR <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/997">#997</a> as the base, fixing all existing issues to get all unit/feature tests passing, and fixed merge conflicts with latest code. Then used the feature files from PR <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1058">#1058</a> to add tests for functionality.</p> <p>Also updated files under /docs/ to describe the new hook usage.</p> <p>Not sure what all is still required before this attempted solution can be merged, besides possibly more unit tests?</p>

Kārlis Amoliņš
2020-10-08 16:52:17

Howdy! 👋 Nothing urgent - but would love to get some feedback on this POC https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1446

Jonas Amundsen
2020-10-26 05:38:48

Regarding optional capturing groups in step definitions and parameter types [1-2], it seems that unmatched capturing group in step definition changed from undefined to null in cucumber-expressions-v7.0.1, when typescript was introduced. Can someone confirm that I'm not just seeing things? Furthermore, was this intentional?

v7.0.0: new RegularExpression(/foo(bar)?/, parameterTypeRegistry) .match("foo") .map((match) =&gt; match.getValue()) // =&gt; [ undefined ] v7.0.1 new RegularExpression(/foo(bar)?/, parameterTypeRegistry) .match("foo") .map((match) =&gt; match.getValue()) // =&gt; [ null ] [1] https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/511 [2] https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/1076

#511 cucumber-expressions: Non maching behavior between CucumberExpression and RegularExpression
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>
#1076 cucumber-expressions: Retain position of optional groups
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>
Jonas Amundsen
2020-10-26 05:44:05

Unmatched capturing group in parameter type transform functions however, appear to be undefined

Jonas Amundsen
2020-10-28 06:27:03

@mpkorstanje, do you agree that they should either both be undefined or null ?

mpkorstanje
2020-10-28 07:38:55

*Thread Reply:* https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/754

Null I think

davidjgoss (https://github.com/davidjgoss)
#754 cucumber-expressions: fix captured empty strings being undefined
<p><strong>Summary</strong></p> <p>Changes to stop captures of empty string parameters being filtered off when interrogating the group, and to the specific transform function so that falsy values are handled</p> <p><strong>Details</strong></p> <p>Added a small guard to the transform function for the "string" parameter type, so falsy values are switched for an empty string.</p> <p>This was enough for the tests to pass, but at the root there was still the issue of this value being undefined, due to the logic in the getter for <code>children</code> in the <code>Group</code> class.</p> <p>What <code>children</code> looks like when the string parameter is empty:</p> <p><a href="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3192745/66713796-27872380-eda7-11e9-9fc3-d4128f701e62.png">image</a></p> <p>What children looks like when the string parameter is non-empty:</p> <p><a href="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3192745/66713847-48e80f80-eda7-11e9-8740-06bdba571396.png">image</a></p> <p>Best I can tell, the previous code used <code>value !== null</code> as the heuristic to filter off the first item; I've changed it to <code>start !== undefined</code>. Although to be fair it didn't seem to be affecting anything else, so technically the guard in the transform is enough.</p> <p><strong>Motivation and Context</strong></p> <p>Fixes <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/746">#746</a></p> <p>Essentially, empty strings are a valid value for a <code>{string}</code> parameter, however these were coming through to the transformer as undefined and then causing an error when the function was expecting a string with a <code>replace</code> method. This was called out as a regression, as it used to work.</p> <p><strong>How Has This Been Tested?</strong></p> <p>Added unit tests to <code>CucumberExpressionTest</code>, those all other tests passing.</p> <p>Confirmed it resolves the issue on the reporter's test case project.</p> <p><strong>Types of changes</strong></p> <p>☑︎ Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue). ☐ New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality). ☐ Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected).</p> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <p>☑︎ The change has been ported to Java. ☑︎ The change has been ported to Ruby. ☑︎ The change has been ported to JavaScript. ☑︎ The change has been ported to Go.<br /> ~- [ ] The change has been ported to .NET.~ ☑︎ I've added tests for my code. ☑︎ My change requires a change to the documentation. ☑︎ I have updated the documentation accordingly.</p> <p>~I haven't checked the behaviour of the other language implementations yet - will do that next but wanted to get early review on this change.~</p>
Labels
library: cucumber-expressions
Comments
14
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>

Aslak Hellesøy
2020-11-05 04:19:56

I'm upgrading html-formatter from webpack 4 to 5. The nice thing is that webpack doesn't ship with default polyfills, which exposes dependencies on libraries that use Node.js APIs that we should avoid using in the browser (the polyfills can be big)

👍 mpkorstanje
Aslak Hellesøy
2020-11-05 04:21:23

We should avoid using snowflake libraries (https://twitter.com/aslak_hellesoy/status/1324324730367889408) - especially in @cucumber/react . Just discovered the recently added git-url-parse is a snowflake library.

twitter
Aslak Hellesøy (https://twitter.com/aslak_hellesoy/status/1324324730367889408)
Is there a term for those JavaScript libraries that contain a single function with transitive dependencies on other similar libs? If not I propose Snowflake Libraries.
Original URL: https://twitter.com/aslak_hellesoy/status/1324324730367889408
Twitter
Aslak Hellesøy
2020-11-05 04:22:22

The transitive dependency graph of https://github.com/IonicaBizau/git-url-parse is disturbing!

IonicaBizau/git-url-parse
<p>✌️ A high level git url parser for common git providers.</p>
Stars
<p>107</p>
Language
<p>JavaScript</p>
<a href="https://github.com/IonicaBizau/git-url-parse">IonicaBizau/git-url-parse</a>
Aslak Hellesøy
2020-11-05 04:23:18

Insane! https://github.com/IonicaBizau/git-url-parse/network/dependencies

mpkorstanje
2020-11-05 04:24:22

*Thread Reply:* I only see 2 dependencies?

Aslak Hellesøy
2020-11-05 04:24:37

*Thread Reply:* Expand them. Turtles all the way down.

mpkorstanje
2020-11-05 04:26:12

*Thread Reply:* Yikes, which of these are actually transitive and which are test/dev scoped?

Aslak Hellesøy
2020-11-05 04:26:21

*Thread Reply:* Granted, some of these are dev dependencies, but it's still atrocious.

Aslak Hellesøy
2020-11-05 05:01:36

@Vincent Pretre I'm adding webpack to @cucumber/react (purely as a build step). This is so we can detect usage of libs that require polyfills, so we can remove them. This should help reduce the js bundle size.

Andrew Irwin
2020-11-17 09:29:10

2020-12-01 02:35:10

seb
2020-12-02 13:33:28

I’m looking at updating cucumber-pretty to work with 7.0.0 … most of the events seem to be the same, but the payload has moved around. The custom formatter example is useful, but insufficient. Can anyone explain the changes to me? cc @David Goss

seb
2020-12-04 04:17:59

*Thread Reply:* @David Goss - my blocker right now is getting the step keyword & text from envelope.testStepStarted event.

David Goss
2020-12-04 04:19:18

*Thread Reply:* sorry for late reply. will have a quick look

David Goss
2020-12-04 06:07:34

*Thread Reply:* Okay so I was never really familiar with the previous event model but essentially it’s the protobuf structure defined here https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/blob/master/messages/messages.proto#L594 - the messages are pretty thin but contain ids of other messages where you can get more info

messages/messages.proto:594
<pre><code>message TestStepStarted { </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>
David Goss
2020-12-04 06:08:27

*Thread Reply:* So in this case the TestStepStarted one should have a testStepId property

David Goss
2020-12-04 06:08:43

*Thread Reply:* And there should have been a corresponding TestStep message emitted with that id, which in turn can be linked to a PickleStep which should have what you need e.g text

David Goss
2020-12-04 06:09:09

*Thread Reply:* I think the @cucumber/query library has a helper for that, let me find that quickly

David Goss
2020-12-04 06:10:57

*Thread Reply:* @seb and/or do you have a branch i could checkout and look at?

seb
2020-12-04 06:32:24

*Thread Reply:* I’m in cucumber-ltd/shouty.js on a branch called cucumber-pretty

seb
2020-12-04 06:32:59

*Thread Reply:* I’m actually working in a class called simple_formatter.js

seb
2020-12-04 06:34:59

*Thread Reply:* I’ve got the pickleStepMap and the gherkinStepMap, but I’m getting a failure from getStepKeyword(). I saw a guard clause in cucumber-js’s json_formatter in onTestRunFinished, but I’ve been unable to replicate it.

seb
2020-12-04 06:48:29

Aslak Hellesøy
2020-12-10 11:15:41

*Thread Reply:* Hi! We've said that any major release needs to be preceded with an RC. And that 4 weeks must elapse between RC and major.

If all that's added after the RC is bugfixes, then we don't need another RC - we can go straight to major.

Aslak Hellesøy
2020-12-10 11:16:02

*Thread Reply:* Since we're bumping major it's OK to remove the browser support. I'd have loved to keep it, but the cost of fighting with webpack vs the low number of users using it I find that hard to justify.

Aslak Hellesøy
2020-12-10 11:17:20

*Thread Reply:* WDYT @David Goss @jbpros?

David Goss
2020-12-10 12:57:41

*Thread Reply:* Okay since rc0 which was ~12 weeks ago we have:

• made html formatter a built-in • added support for BeforeStep and AfterStep • changed custom formatter loading to support module names • fixed an issue with the meta message • (various build fixes, renovate updates, docs tweaks) @Aslak Hellesøy if I read you right are you happy to do a 7.0.0 without another RC (once we get the browser example removal in)?

CHANGELOG.md
<pre><code># Changelog All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](&lt;http://keepachangelog.com/&gt;) and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](&lt;http://semver.org/&gt;). Please see [CONTRIBUTING.md](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md&gt;) on how to contribute to Cucumber. ---- ## [Unreleased] (In Git) ### Added ** Add a built in `html` formatter for rich HTML reports output as a standalone page ([#1432](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1432&gt;)) ** Add support for `BeforeStep` and `AfterStep` hooks ([#1416](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1416&gt;)) ** Custom formatters can now be resolved by a module name (as well as by a relative path), enabling use of Yarn PnP ([#1413](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1413&gt;)) ### Changed ### Deprecated ### Removed ### Fixed ** Wrong version in meta message [#1439](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1439&gt;) [#1442](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1442&gt;) ## [7.0.0-rc.0] (2020-09-14) Starting with version 7, the npm module has been changed from `cucumber` to `@cucumber/cucumber` ### Migration guide - `npm uninstall cucumber` - `npm install --save-dev @cucumber/cucumber` - require/import `@cucumber/cucumber` instead of `cucumber` - TypeScript - Replace `TableDefinition` with `DataTable` - `npm uninstall @types/cucumber` If anything is missing from the migration guide, please submit an issue. ### New Features ** Add `--publish` option to publish reports to [&lt;a href="http://reports.cucumber.io"&gt;reports.cucumber.io&lt;/a&gt;](&lt;https://reports.cucumber.io&gt;) [#1423](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1423&gt;), [#1424](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1424&gt;) ** Add support for Gherkin's [Rule/Example syntax](&lt;https://cucumber.io/docs/gherkin/reference/#rule&gt;) ** Add `transpose` method to [data table interface](docs/support_files/data_table_interface.md) ** Add `log` function to world, providing a shorthand to log plain text as [attachment(s)](docs/support_files/attachments.md) ** Now includes [TypeScript](&lt;https://www.typescriptlang.org/&gt;) type definitions, deprecating the need for `@types/cucumber` in TypeScript projects ### Breaking changes ** The npm module has changed name from `cucumber` to `@cucumber/cucumber` ** Your `require` / `import` statements must be changed from `cucumber` to `@cucumber/cucumber` ** TypeScript users must rename `TableDefinition` to `DataTable` ** Drop support for Node.js 8, add support for Node.js 14 ** Formatters ** Events are now based on [cucumber-messages](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/tree/master/messages&gt;) ** `event-protocol` formatter has been removed and replaced with `message` ** Custom formatters will need to migrate ** `json` formatter is deprecated and will be removed in next major release. Custom formatters should migrate to use the `message` formatter, or the [standalone JSON formatter](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/tree/master/json-formatter&gt;) as a stopgap. ** Remove long-deprecated `typeName` from options object for `defineParameterType` in favour of `name` ** Custom formatters are now loaded via the regular require paths relative to the current directory, unless it begins with a dot (e.g. `--format=./relpath/to/formatter`). Previously this was always loaded as a file relative to the current directory. ### Bug fixes ** don't execute BeforeAll and AfterAll hooks when in dry-run ** support correct case for `--retry-tag-filter` CLI argument ## [6.0.5] (2019-11-13) ### Bug fixes ** json formatter: fix duration to be nanoseconds (was femtoseconds) ## [6.0.4] (2019-11-10) ### Bug fixes ** retry: create a new World instance for every attempt ## [6.0.3] (2019-10-27) ** Revert JSON formatter changes to be backward compatible ## [6.0.2] (2019-10-07) ** Upgrade to cucumber-expressions 8.0.1 to fix failure on multiple installs ## [6.0.1] (2019-10-06) ** Release to fix missing lib ## [6.0.0] (2019-10-06) ### BREAKING CHANGES ** Drop support for Node.js 6 ** JSON formatter has major breaking changes. View some sample outputs [here](/features/fixtures/formatters/). The `**.json.js` files contain the js objects the json parses to. (UPDATE - reverted in 6.0.3) ** Duration is now in nanoseconds in event-protocol formatter and in events sent to custom formatters ** Custom formatters: Formatter helpers and EventDataCollector had breaking changes to support retry ### Bug fixes ** Prevent after hooks from updating skipped scenarios to passed ** Parallel: beforeAll / afterAll errors fail the suite ** Fix CLI help link ### New features ** Add ability to retry flaky tests ** Use `--retry &amp;lt;NUMBER&amp;gt;` and limit what tests will be retried with `--retryTagFilter &amp;lt;EXPRESSION&amp;gt;` ** Event-protocol added an `attemptNumber` to test case started, test case finished, and all test step events and a `retried` boolean to the test case result to signify if the test case was retried ** usage-json formatter: add code and patternType ** Add support for Node.js 12 ## [5.1.0] (2018-12-28) ### Internals ** Upgrade to babel 7 ## [5.0.3] (2018-12-03) ### Speed Improvements ** Only create Cucumber Expressions once ## [5.0.2] (2018-10-06) ### Bug Fixes ** Update default of formatters' colors enabled to be true only if the stream is a TTY ** Allow writing to stdout when running in parallel ** Skip other before hooks if one returns skipped ## [5.0.1] (2018-04-09) ### Bug Fixes ** Update dependencies to avoid licensing problems ## [5.0.0] (2018-04-09) ### BREAKING CHANGES ** Drop support for Node.js 4 ### Bug Fixes ** Update dependencies to avoid licensing problems ** Provide better error message when trying to attach data after the scenario has finished. This is possible if not waiting for the attach to finish. ### New features ** Add support for Node.js 10 ## [4.2.1] (2018-04-09) ### Bug Fixes ** improve the error message for gherkin parse errors ## [4.2.0] (2018-04-03) ** add cli option `--order &amp;lt;TYPE[:SEED]&amp;gt;` to run scenarios in the specified order. Type should be `defined` or `random` ## [4.1.0] (2018-03-27) ### New Features ** update step timeout error message for each interface ([#1028](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1028&gt;), Bruce Lindsay) ** default to synchronous snippets ** print text step attachments ([#1041](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1041&gt;), DevSide) ### Bug Fixes ** cucumber-expressions: Upgrade from 5.0.7 to [5.0.13](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/blob/master/cucumber-expressions/CHANGELOG.md#5013---2018-01-21&gt;) ** fix error serialization in parallel mode ## [4.0.0] (2018-01-24) ### BREAKING CHANGES ** cucumber now waits for the event loop to drain before exiting. To exit immediately when the tests finish running use `--exit`. Use of this flag is discouraged. See [here](/docs/cli.md#exiting) for more information ** remove `--compiler` option. See [here](/docs/cli.md#transpilers) for the new way to use transpilers ** remove binaries `cucumber.js` and `cucumberjs`. Use `cucumber-js` ### New Features ** can now use glob patterns for selecting what features to run ** update `--require` to support glob patterns ** add `--require-module &amp;lt;NODE_MODULE&amp;gt;` to require node modules before support code is loaded ** add snippet interface "async-await" ** add `--parallel &amp;lt;NUMBER_OF_SLAVES&amp;gt;` option to run tests in parallel. Note this is an experimental feature. See [here](/docs/cli.md#parallel-experimental) for more information ### Bug Fixes ** revert json formatter duration to nanoseconds ### Deprecations ** `defineSupportCode` is deprecated. Require/import the individual methods instead ```js var {defineSupportCode} = require('cucumber'); defineSupportCode(function({Given}) { Given(/^a step$/, function() {}); }); // Should be updated to var {Given} = require('cucumber'); Given(/^a step$/, function() {}); </code></pre> <h2>[3.2.1] (2018-01-03)</h2> <h3>Bug …</h3>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>

Aslak Hellesøy
2020-12-14 10:12:47

*Thread Reply:* And I have pushed a PR that hopefully fixes cucumber/cucumber#1275

aslakhellesoy (https://github.com/aslakhellesoy)
#1275 Use react-markdown instead of marked+sanitizeHtml
<p>The current solution is vulnerable to XSS, and it also causes cucumber-html to fail the build since sanitizeHtml requires polyfills for the browser.</p> <p>More info here:</p> <p>• <a href="https://github.com/remarkjs/react-markdown#readme">https://github.com/remarkjs/react-markdown#readme</a></p>
Labels
language: javascript, library: cucumber-react, type: bug
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>
David Goss
2020-12-14 10:16:54

*Thread Reply:* Reviewed!

David Goss
2020-12-14 10:17:18

*Thread Reply:* I need to have a quick look at https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1511 but suspect it’s user error (not quoting the string) esp. given we haven’t released a version with that change yet

kamarkiewicz (https://github.com/kamarkiewicz)
#1511 Regression introduced with commander update (v6)
<p><a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1472">#1472</a> seem to introduce regression for <code>--format-options</code> flag. It should handle JSON input, i.e. <code>--format-options {"scenarioAsStep": false}</code>, but after the version change I couldn't find a way to pass the custom options to CLI.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>

aslakhellesoy (https://github.com/aslakhellesoy)
#1280 Verify HTML reports with puppeteer
<p>This automates the verification of generated HTML reports by rendering them with puppeteer. If the rendering fails, the build fails.</p> <p>In order to make it pass I also had to downgrade to webpack 4 - not sure what's up with webpack 5.</p>
Labels
language: javascript, library: html-formatter
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>

jbpros
2020-12-26 15:44:15

I'm working on a rewrite of cucumber-pretty for Cucumber.js 7 compatibility. Feel free to give feedback: https://github.com/kozhevnikov/cucumber-pretty/pull/16

(Note: I know the ultimate goal is to build a language agnostic pretty formatter usable by all cucumber flavours, this is a "temporary" solution for people urgently needing the JS pretty formatter)

jbpros (https://github.com/jbpros)
#16 Cucumber 7
<p>As announced, this PR is based off <a href="https://github.com/kozhevnikov/cucumber-pretty/pull/15">#15</a>. All the existing tests are passing. The codebase has been mostly rewritten (and is in TypeScript), and the tests have undergone some refactoring.</p> <p>This is currently a draft as I still need to implement support for the <a href="https://cucumber.io/docs/gherkin/reference/#Rule"><code>Rule</code> keyword</a>.</p> <p>Feedback welcome!</p> <p>/cc <a href="https://github.com/aslakhellesoy">@aslakhellesoy</a> <a href="https://github.com/mattwynne">@mattwynne</a> <a href="https://github.com/davidjgoss">@davidjgoss</a> <a href="https://github.com/charlierudolph">@charlierudolph</a> <a href="https://github.com/sebrose">@sebrose</a> <a href="https://github.com/tooky">@tooky</a></p>
Comments
1
<a href="https://github.com/kozhevnikov/cucumber-pretty">kozhevnikov/cucumber-pretty</a>
Royi Freifeld

@Royi Freifeld has joined the channel

jbpros
2021-01-07 08:22:58

As decided during stand up today, I've made a new repo for the cucumber-js pretty formatter https://github.com/jbpros/cucumber-pretty-formatter I worked on for the last three weeks. This is a temporary home, @Aslak Hellesøy offered to help me move it to the monorepo as a second step. And then turn it into the official pretty formatter for all cucumber flavours (that's a longer-term goal, obvs 😉)

I'm referencing older versions in the README and give credit to the original author. I'll soon publish the thing to NPM as @cucumber/pretty-formatter, version 1.0.0-rc.0. Feedback welcome, as always!

jbpros/cucumber-pretty-formatter
<p>Cucumber.js pretty formatter</p>
Language
<p>TypeScript</p>
Last updated
<p>13 minutes ago</p>

David Goss
2021-02-09 01:20:16

*Thread Reply:* Okay fix is here https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1572 - feedback welcome on the dependency pinning thing

davidjgoss (https://github.com/davidjgoss)
#1572 update expressions dependency and match changed signature
<p>Fixes <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1571">#1571</a></p> <p><code>cucumber-expressions</code> had <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-expressions-javascript/commit/4c092a16b169e4e2d50b32112e60cb8d7241c7ef">a fix</a> which changed the constructor signature but was released as patch. Because of the <code>^</code> in our dependency version, new installs in the wild started picking this version up and breaking at runtime.</p> <p>This PR:</p> <p>• Updates the version of <code>cucumber-expressions</code> and fixes the affected code • Sets all the versions of <code>@cucumber/**</code> dependencies to the exact version - this is definitely debatable as it takes away the possibility for fixes in monorepo libraries getting to users without releasing cucumber-js, but feels safer and more controlled.</p>
Reviewers
@aslakhellesoy, @jbpros, @charlierudolph
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-09 04:48:21

*Thread Reply:* Do you want to give that a go @Aurélien Reeves? Following the release instructions here? https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/blob/master/RELEASE_PROCESS.md

RELEASE_PROCESS.md
<pre><code># Release process The release process is automated from the command line. When a package is released, _all_ implementations of the package are released. For example, when you release `cucumber-expressions`, it will release the Java, Ruby, Go and JavaScript implementations of that library, with the same version number. You **must** be on the `master` branch when you make a release. The steps below outline the process: ** Start the docker container with secrets ** Update dependencies ** Update changelog ** Release packages The release commands will be done from a terminal session in the Docker container. This ensures a consistent release environment. ## Get the secrets In order to publish packages several secrets are required. Members of the core team can install keybase and join the `cucumberbdd` team to access these secrets. ## Start the Cucumber docker container All commands should be made from the Cucumber docker container. Start it: make docker-run-with-secrets You're now ready to make a release. ## Update changelog Open `CHANGELOG.md` and remove any `###` headers without content. Do not commit. No further edits should be made. The markdown headers and links will be updated automatically in the next step. ## Decide what the next version should be This depends on what's changed (see `CHANGELOG.md`): ** Bump `MAJOR` if: ** There are `Changed` or `Removed` entries ** A cucumber library dependency upgrade was major ** Bump `MINOR` if: ** There are `Added` entries ** Bump `PATCH` if: ** There are `Fixed` or `Deprecated` entries ## Prepare the release cd thepackage make clean Run the `pre-release` target: NEW_VERSION=X.Y.Z make pre-release This will update the package version in the package descriptor and `CHANGELOG.md`. It will also update dependencies and verify that the build passes. The changes made **will not** be committed to git. Examine what changed: git diff Inspect the diff, and undo any changes that you think shouldn't have been made. Make sure the package still builds, and that the tests are still passing: make clean &amp;amp;&amp;amp; make **** Special note for html-formatter **** We need to verify that the webpacked JavaScript runs in the browser. Run the following on your host OS (it won't work in Docker): make clean CHECK_INTEGRITY=1 make If all is good, proceed to the next step. Otherwise, make the necessary edits until the build passes. ## Release packages Make sure you're in the package directory (e.g `/cucumber-expressions`). Publish a release with the following command: NEW_VERSION=X.Y.Z make release This will: ** Commit all the changed files ** Create a git tag ** Publish all the packages Check that releases show up under: ** `&lt;https://rubygems.org/gems/[package]/versions/[version]&gt;` ** `&lt;https://www.npmjs.com/package/[package]&gt;` ** `&lt;https://search.maven.org/search?q=a:[package]&gt;` (This will take a few hours to show up) ** `&lt;https://www.nuget.org/packages/[package]/[version]&gt;` ** `&lt;https://cloud.docker.com/u/cucumber/repository/list&gt;` (If the package has a Dockerfile) ## Post release Run the following command (using the same NEW_VERSION as you used for the release): NEW_VERSION=X.Y.Z make post-release This should update the version in `java/pom.xml` file to use a `-SNAPSHOT` suffix and add `replace` directives in the `go.mod` file. This is automatically committed, and pushed along with the tag of the release. If you did a new major release of a Go package, you must also update all the references in the libraries using it: # Run this in the root directory source scripts/functions.sh &amp;amp;&amp;amp; update_go_library_version libraryName X.Y.Z </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>

davidjgoss (https://github.com/davidjgoss)
#1572 update cucumber libraries to latest
<p>This PR:</p> <p>• Updates the versions of libraries and updates our code accordingly • Sets all the versions of <code>@cucumber/**</code> dependencies to the exact version - this is definitely debatable as it takes away the possibility for fixes in monorepo libraries getting to users without releasing cucumber-js, but feels safer and more controlled.</p>

Reviewers
@aslakhellesoy, @jbpros, @charlierudolph, @aurelien-reeves
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
Aurélien Reeves
2021-02-09 04:41:28

@Aurélien Reeves has joined the channel

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-22 08:52:06

Hi @Aurélien Reeves @David Goss - one of my goals with the npm workspaces PR is to be able to: • clone the repo • npm i from root • cd into any js module and run npm test In other words, being able to run tests without having to npm build between every edit to transpile everything. Having to do that is a very tedious workflow.

So I have started adding tsconfig-paths to make this possible. Part of this work is that import "@cucumber/xyz/dist/foo/bar" will no longer work.

👍 Aurélien Reeves, David Goss
Aurélien Reeves
2021-02-23 00:16:33

*Thread Reply:* FYI I've added html-formatter and json-to-messages to workspaces. But at the moment I did not push those changes on github.

We may need to go a little bit further with your current work before pushing my changes

Also, we may encounter some difficulties with the html-formatter: its build script is not the same as the other packages. Any idea on how to workaround this?

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-22 08:53:31

This is a good thing - the dist imports were a hack anyway. I introduced it recently when I did some work to make some of the modules work in the browser without a polyfill for nodejs libs.

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-22 08:55:22

So the solution is to move code that depends on nodejs API (stream, fs etc) out of the modules they are currently in, and into a new module. This is why I added a new message-streams module. I'm about to add a gherkin-streams module too.

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-23 08:11:41

On the workspace PR: I've added npm run upgrade to the root package.json

👍 Aurélien Reeves
Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-23 08:12:08

This will upgrade all libs (it does the same as renovate bot, just faster and better)

Aurélien Reeves
2021-02-25 05:47:14

@Aslak Hellesøy I continue to take a look on Circle-CI and try to fix the broken jobs for the workspaces

Aurélien Reeves
2021-02-25 06:54:38

*Thread Reply:* I've pushed a commit to fix the create-meta/javascript job: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/1372/files#diff-8fba547243309a0d68b122e7f083a83023eb87bfcf1a31bda2dab2c78ae90ec5

My though is that in order to execute the acceptance tests, the modules needs to be built. So I added it to the makefile, after the first npm test have passed.

I'm not sure that would be the best fix. I pushed it as-is to start a discussion about that point: how to manage jobs wich requires the modules to be build before executing the acceptance checks?

Aurélien Reeves
2021-02-25 23:13:26

*Thread Reply:* I continue working on it this morning

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-25 23:50:17

*Thread Reply:* Morning @Aurélien Reeves

Aurélien Reeves
2021-02-25 23:50:46

*Thread Reply:* Morning 🙂

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-25 23:52:09

*Thread Reply:* Starting a bit earlier today 🙂

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-25 23:54:42

*Thread Reply:* I see you fixed https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/cucumber/cucumber/5238/workflows/2aedb6a6-85fb-4b5c-9161-b7c45553bcd1/jobs/191806 by running npm run build - I think there is a better way that doesn't require building. I think we should avoid building from root in order to make builds pass.

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-25 23:58:12

*Thread Reply:* The error says ../dist/src/printMeta cannot be found. We could just remove bin/print-meta use ts-node to execute src/printMeta.ts directly. That way no transpilation from the root folder is necessary

Aurélien Reeves
2021-02-26 00:01:19

*Thread Reply:* Yes, I agree. My fix was not that good.

At the moment I am refactoring the CI. I have added a npm-build step right after the npm-install for the modules wich requires resulting files from a build.

That should lead to a more clean and readable pipeline.

But if we find ways to avoid that requirements for all the modules that would actually be great!

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 00:10:48

*Thread Reply:* Why are you running npm run build ?

Aurélien Reeves
2021-02-26 00:20:43

*Thread Reply:* I though that some modules depends on other modules build artifacts.

After a deeper look, it seems they actually depends more on make artifacts than build ones.

Also I though that would be a good idea to run the build in the CI to make sure it works well.

Aurélien Reeves
2021-02-26 00:27:16

*Thread Reply:* What I was trying to achieve was to organize the pipeline in stages where • the first one would install dependencies - npm ci • then we could generate all artifacts wich may be required later like builds and test data files • then we could execute the tests. If some tests don't need artifacts they could be executed right after the npm ci job.

What do you think?

David Goss
2021-02-26 00:38:26

*Thread Reply:* It feels like there are two categories of test. I would view the stages as:

• npm ci • npm test • npm run build • npm run acceptance-tests

David Goss
2021-02-26 00:41:11

*Thread Reply:* Where test would include linting and unit tests, which wouldn't rely on build. If there are tests that test against the built artifact and/or CLI then they could be categorised as acceptance tests, and you do those on a package-by-package basis depending what you're actively working on.

David Goss
2021-02-26 00:41:37

*Thread Reply:* (I'm probably missing some context, please tell me if I'm way off)

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 00:48:09

*Thread Reply:* Imagine module x depends on module y. When I make a change in y I want those changes to be picked up by x without needing to rebuild anything.

Aurélien Reeves
2021-02-26 00:50:44

*Thread Reply:* Of course, that would be great

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 00:50:49

*Thread Reply:* That's why I don't want the build system to require building anything. I think we should only build (tsc ) for two reasons:

• Before making releases (prepublishOnly) • To optionally speed up acceptance tests

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 00:52:58

*Thread Reply:* One example where it's useful to (optionally) compile before running acceptance tests is for the gherkin acceptance tests.

It should work with ts-node on uncompiled .ts code. However, since we'll launch Node hundreds of times, we should make it possible to optionally speed it up by building first.

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 00:54:02

*Thread Reply:* In general:

if code is compiled then use node.js # fast else use ts-node # slow but more ergonomic / better developer experience end

David Goss
2021-02-26 00:54:30

*Thread Reply:* I would have much more confidence in those acceptance tests and subsequent release if they used the same file that lands on npm

David Goss
2021-02-26 00:55:13

*Thread Reply:* In the Gherkin example, the Gherkin acce. tests relying on Gherkin's build doesn't slow you down when working on e.g. react, right?

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 00:55:47

*Thread Reply:* I think that's correct

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 00:56:41

*Thread Reply:* Ok, I can see why it makes sense to compile the code for acceptance tests

David Goss
2021-02-26 00:57:01

*Thread Reply:* But objective still met in terms of general developer ergonomics!

David Goss
2021-02-26 00:57:34

*Thread Reply:* And the rule is if package B consumes package A then you shouldn't have to build A just to work on B

👍 Aslak Hellesøy, Aurélien Reeves
Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 00:58:42

*Thread Reply:* That begs two questions: • Whose responsibility is it to run tsc for acceptance tests? Is it the developer who should run npm run build from the root before running acceptance tests, or should the acceptance tests themselves do it transparently? • What do we consider acceptance tests?

David Goss
2021-02-26 01:24:55

*Thread Reply:* • I think the acceptance tests calling build makes sense. Could be done with a preacceptance-tests script hook • Simplistically, everything except linting and unit tests? Should we start there and review what those are? The gherkin and create-meta ones seem like good examples, also thinking of the verification we do on html-formatter with puppeteer

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 01:26:33

*Thread Reply:* I think the create-meta ones are few enough that we can live with the ts-node overhead and not require a build.

I think only the gherkin acceptance tests really need to precompiled.

David Goss
2021-02-25 16:03:59

Was the bounty on this intentional? https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1302 (I don't think there is agreement on whether it's actually an issue)

stefdelec (https://github.com/stefdelec)
#1302 rerun rerun all test if @rerun.txt is empty
<p>If <code>@rerun.txt</code> exists and has not failing test in it (empty), it runs all features.</p> <p><code>cucumber-js @rerun.txt cucumber-js @rerun.txt</code></p> <p>If I had one failed test, it runs only the the specified test.</p>
Labels
💵 bounty $300, ⚡ enhancement
Comments
2
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
mpkorstanje
2021-02-25 23:06:32

*Thread Reply:* I think it was. The semantics in jvm are such that an empty rerun file executes nothing.

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 00:01:31

*Thread Reply:* I cannot tell if that issue describes the current behaviour or desired behaviour.

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 00:02:12

*Thread Reply:* An empty rerun.txt file should run all scenarios.

mpkorstanje
2021-02-26 00:04:07

*Thread Reply:* A common usecase is to rerun failures immediately after a test run.

cucumber example.feature -p rerun:rerun.txt // no failures cucumber @rerun.txt // no tests run

mpkorstanje
2021-02-26 00:04:25

*Thread Reply:* So running all tests twice on succesful run wouldn't make too much sense.

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 00:06:41

*Thread Reply:* @mpkorstanje do you think an empty file should run no scenarios?

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 00:08:30

*Thread Reply:* So the only way to get back to running them all is to delete the file? That sounds counterintuitive to me. To me, an empty file is equivalent to no file.

mpkorstanje
2021-02-26 00:08:57

*Thread Reply:* One sec.

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 00:09:43

*Thread Reply:* I suppose it depends on whether people have hardcorded @rerun.txt in a script, or if they specify arguments to cucumber for each invocation

David Goss
2021-02-26 00:10:36

*Thread Reply:* People's wording on the issue isn't clear but I think Charlie is taking the same position as Aslak. I agree on principle, would match behaviour of other test runners like Jest, Ava that have interactive modes and after you fix the last failure you rerun the whole suite again.

mpkorstanje
2021-02-26 00:11:17

*Thread Reply:* Currently we are doing: if rerun file/feature arguments merge rerun file contents and feature arguments run merged arguments else scan the class path and run everything found

mpkorstanje
2021-02-26 00:15:03

*Thread Reply:* @Aslak Hellesøy you did add a bounty. Perhaps don't do this with issues that haven't gone through triage.

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-02-26 01:19:29

*Thread Reply:* I did indeed. Adding the bounty tag is currently part of the Triage process: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/blob/master/TRIAGE.md#daily-routine

When do you suggest we do it?

TRIAGE.md
<pre><code># Triage Target audience: Regular contributors to Cucumber Open. This document describes how issues and pull requests (work items) are triaged across the Cucumber GitHub organisation. The purpose of a triage process is to make it easier for **regular** contributors to decide what to work on next. Triage should ideally happen whenever a new work item is submitted, but for practical reasons the triage may happen at less frequent intervals (ideally at least a couple of times a week). ## Daily routine The first step of the triage process is to assign relevant labels to new issues and pull requests. We maintain a [consistent set of labels](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/1326&gt;) across repositories to make this simpler. Sometimes a bit of discussion in the ticket is needed before we can label them correctly. ** Label unlabelled issues: ** Exactly one of the following: ** ✅ `accepted` to indicate that we'd welcome a PR for this ** 🙅 `wont fix` for issues we won't fix (or don't want a fix for) ** Also close these issues ** At least one of these: ** 🥒 `core team` these are issues that the core team will give priority to ** 🙏 `help wanted` for accepted issues, but not a priority to the core team ** 💵 `bounty` if we want to draw extra attention to an issue ** 🔥 `critical` for issues that make it onto the [Cucumber Open board] ** And one of these: ** 🐛 `bug` ** ⚡ `enhancement` ** Reply to new issues ** Engage in Slack conversations ** Merge Renovate bot pull requests ## Weekly routine ** Community Zoom meetings ** Make Releases ** Adding new work items to the [Cucumber Open board] ** Partly informed by the weekly Zoom call ** Partly informed by the labels ### Pulling into Next We aim to have about a dozen or so work items in the `Next` column at any given time so that regular contributors have a bit of choice (but not too much choice) when they pick up something new to work on. ### Pull priority Pull requests and issues tagged with 🔥 `critical` **always** have higher priority than regular issues. In other words, the [Cucumber Open board] should **only** have pull requests and 🔥 `critical` issues. The reason for this is to build a culture that: ** nurtures new contributors ** places a higher value on "work done" (pull requests) than "work requested" (issues). When pulling from `Next` to `In Progress` - pull the **top** work item if you can. When adding new work items into `Next` - put them at the bottom. What gets pulled into `Next` is decided based on the following guidelines: ** The `Next` column should ideally have a mix of pull requests and 🔥 `critical` issues ** A mix of repositories: ** [cucumber/cucumber](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues?q=is%3Aopen+sort%3Acreated-asc&gt;) ** [cucumber/cucumber-jvm](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues?q=is%3Aopen+sort%3Acreated-asc&gt;) ** [cucumber/cucumber-ruby](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues?q=is%3Aopen+sort%3Acreated-asc&gt;) ** [cucumber/cucumber-js](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues?q=is%3Aopen+sort%3Acreated-asc&gt;) ** [cucumber/cucumber-rails](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails/issues?q=is%3Aopen+sort%3Acreated-asc&gt;) ** [cucumber/docs.cucumber.io](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/docs.cucumber.io/issues?q=is%3Aopen+sort%3Acreated-asc&gt;) ** The oldest work items have the highest priority to be pulled into Next (FIFO policy) &amp;lt;!-- links --&amp;gt; [Cucumber Open board]: &lt;https://github.com/orgs/cucumber/projects/8&gt; </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>

Aurélien Reeves
2021-03-01 02:34:12

I am stuck trying to fix the cucumber/react ci job in the workspaces PR.

react/javascript depends on storybook wich depends on webpack@4 html-formatter/javascriptdepends on webpack@5

With the workspaces and the monorepo, that means that we have two versions of webpack installed at the same time in node_modules. That leads to the following issue: https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/12606

I've tried to use storybook 6.2 beta 4 wich supports webpack@5 as desdribed here: https://gist.github.com/shilman/8856ea1786dcd247139b47b270912324

But that actually leads to another issue I faced with html-formatter: we have not yet fixed bundling the modules with webpack. It results with dependencies to modules not being resolved.

Does anyone have any ideas around those issues?

David Goss
2021-03-01 03:55:47

*Thread Reply:* > Starting in Storybook 6.2, the manager is bundled in Webpack 4, and the preview can either be bundled in Webpack 4 (default) or Webpack 5 (opt-in) Looks like webpack 4 would still be hanging around in node_modules in this case?

David Goss
2021-03-01 03:56:15

*Thread Reply:* Can you point to some more detail on the html-formatter issues you're seeing?

Aurélien Reeves
2021-03-01 05:13:14

... info =&gt; Using default Webpack5 setup 14% building 1/13 entries 1200/1468 dependencies 154/353 modules[BABEL] Note: The code generator has deoptimised the styling of /home/aurelien/cucumber/cucumber/react/javascript/acceptance/attachments/attachments.ts as it exceeds the max of 500KB. ERR! =&gt; Failed to build the preview ERR! Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '@cucumber/query' in '/home/aurelien/cucumber/cucumber/react/javascript/src/stories' ... Aslak Hellesøy
2021-03-03 03:52:04

@Aurélien Reeves looks like puppeteer doesn't run on CircleCI: https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/cucumber/cucumber/5291/workflows/7792cfbf-61dc-4969-9694-40427b52756b/jobs/194064

I think we should try using the docker-cucumber-build container for the html-formatter-javascript job. But first we should try to make this work in a docker container running locally.

Puppeteer will not install/run unless Chrome is installed in the docker image. We will probably need to update https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-build/ to add Chrome. Maybe we can get some inspiration from https://github.com/buildkite/docker-puppeteer

Aurélien Reeves
2021-03-03 05:23:23

*Thread Reply:* Yes, the line has been removed. That is just to show that actually, even docker-cucumber-build won't make puppeteer work.

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-03-03 05:24:15

*Thread Reply:* The reason it doesn't (yet) work in Docker is that puppeteer can't find shared libraries to run chrome. That's why I suggested we update our docker image.

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-03-03 05:25:53

*Thread Reply:* Do you understand what I mean?

Aurélien Reeves
2021-03-03 05:27:45

*Thread Reply:* Oh, yes 👍

David Goss
2021-03-03 05:35:58

*Thread Reply:* Puppeteer downloads its own exact chromium to use, so doesn't technically need chrome, but it does depend on a bunch of shared libs and probably the easiest way to have them is to install chrome stable. thats what we have on work infra where we use puppeteer. i think theres an issue/doc in the puppeteer repo that lists the exact ones it needs

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-03-03 05:37:02

*Thread Reply:* Yes, this is explained here: https://github.com/buildkite/docker-puppeteer/blob/9e0c7579d125eb762977554c480f852e849e97d0/Dockerfile#L12-L16

Dockerfile:12-16
<pre><code> # We install Chrome to get all the OS level dependencies, but Chrome itself # is not actually used as it's packaged in the node puppeteer library. # Alternatively, we could could include the entire dep list ourselves # (&lt;https://github.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/blob/master/docs/troubleshooting.md#chrome-headless-doesnt-launch-on-unix&gt;) # but that seems too easy to get out of date. </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/buildkite/docker-puppeteer">buildkite/docker-puppeteer</a>
👍 David Goss

Aurélien Reeves
2021-03-10 02:02:35

Hello there 🙂

Regarding our work on NPM workspaces, I have some questions: • what will be the impact on subtree repos? • does it matter? As you know, I am a newbie here 😅 so: what are the purpose of subtree repos? • any idea on how to manage that?

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-03-10 02:44:46

I think we can get rid of (archive) the read-only subtree repos for TypeScript modules. We put them in place so that people on the bleeding edge could consume unreleased code with npm git dependencies.

This stopped working when we swtiched to typescript anyway, and I don't think anyone relies on it.

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-03-10 02:45:13

It's still needed for go because go modules are git repos.

mpkorstanje
2021-03-10 02:45:37

I don't think we need them for Java either.

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-03-10 02:46:02

Agree. I think we should archive them all except for go.

mpkorstanje
2021-03-10 02:46:11

We'll have to update some references first:

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/blob/master/create-meta/java/pom.xml#L23
